page.title: 04THE BEACH continued
page.content: amusement arcades, snack bars and even a small fair. The Pensarn beach is one of contrasting land covers: near the sea it is very sandy, but further on towards Rhyl, the finer the sand becomes; but near the top there is a large area of wasteland, unsown and little fertilised patches of grassland and stones- this is because the sea does not reach that far except occasionally in the spring mean tide. A prominent feature of the Pensarn beach is its wildlife, many types of animals live around this area but by far the most dominant are the birds. Several types of birds can be seen often gliding over the beach, including:Herring Gulls; Common Gulls; Oyster Catchers; Ringed Plover, and Mallard.
